titleStmt.title: ʾO-ʾǝgziʾǝyä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos ʿǝqäbänni... “Oh my Lord Jesus Christ, protect me...” / Mälkǝʾa ʾIyäsus “Image of Jesus” / Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” / Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” / Protective prayers / Excerpts from Haymanotä ʾabäw “Faith of the Fathers” / Excerpt from the Revelation of John

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the name of the donor and his family members; two initial lines on the incipit of Text I; incipit of Text II; a few groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text III; the incipit of the main sections of Text III and their subsections (a homily, absolution prayer, miracle and ʾarke); the word sälam “salutation” in Text II; the incipit of Texts IV-VI; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

msItem.note: - Text I contains information about the translator (fols. 6vb-7ra): ተርጎምክዎ፡ አነ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ እምነገ፡ አፍርንጊ፡ ኅበ፡ ሀገረ[sic]፡ ኢትዮጵያ “I, Gäbrä Krǝstos, translated it from the language of foreigners to the language of Ethiopia.” (cf. EMML no. 4431, fols. 38b-65b)
- Text II begins with the following words: Sälam läki ʾo-rǝst qǝddǝst zä-bezawinä... “Salutation to You, Oh the Holy Head of Our Redeemer”
- Text IV contains the following miracles (cf. Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus, Addis Abäba 1994 A.M. [2001/02 A.D.]):
1) On the presentation of the Virgin Mary at the Temple (fols. 61ra-63ra) (cf. miracle 3)
2) On bewaring of the tribe of the Black Nomads (fols. 63rb-64va l.6) (cf. miracle 75)
3) On how the apostles were given the power (fols. 64va l.6-65va l.5) (cf. miracle 76)
4) On how the disciples ask Our Lord about His second coming (fols. 65va l.5-66rb) (cf. miracle 77)
5) On the rising of the lost son from the tribe of Dan (fols. 66rb-67va) (cf. miracle 67, p. 203 ff)
6) On being watchful (fols. 67va-68vb) (cf. miracle 69)
7) On how Our Lord healed a blind and a mute man who suffered from leprosy (fols. 68vb-69rb) (cf. Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat, Addis Abäba 1950, p. 155-6)
- Text VI contains the following excerpts from Haymanotä ʾabäw “Faith of the Fathers” (cf. Haymanotä ʾabäw, Addis Abäba 1967 A.M. [1974/05 A.D.])
1) Credo of Severos of Antioch addressed to Emperor Anastasius (fols. 71ra-74vb) (cf. ch. 84, part 1)
2) Homily by Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 74vb-75rb) (cf. ch. 73, part 12)
3) Excerpt from the 5th book of Cyril of Alexandria “Against Nestorius” (fols. 75rb-76ra) (cf. ch. 73, part 13)
4) Letter of Cyril of Alexandria to John the Bishop of Antioch (fol. 76ra-rb) (cf. ch. 73, part 14)
5) Excerpt from the book of Athanasius the Apostolic (fols. 76ra-78ra) (cf. ch. 26, parts 5-9)
6) Homily by Athanasius the Apostolic on the Incarnation of Christ (fol. 78ra-rb) (cf. ch. 27, part 10)
7) Homily by Athanasius the Apostolic on the life-giving Passion (fols. 78rb-vb) (cf. ch. 27, part 11)
8) Homily by Athanasius the Apostolic on the Holy Trinity (fols. 78vb-79ra) (cf. ch. 27, part 12)
9) Homily by Athanasius the Apostolic on the Incarnation (fol. 79ra-rb) (cf. ch. 27, part 13)

list.item:
Fol. 1v: Donation note. Fol. 1v: <…> መጽሐፍ፡ የብጅር፡ ወዲ፡ ገብረ፡ መድህን፡ ዘወሃቦ፡ ለመድሐኒ፡ አለም፡ ለቤተ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ዘተሣየጦ፡ በንዋዩ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መርሃ፡ ለመንግተ[sic]፡ ሰማይ: ለገብሩ፡ ገብረ፡ መድሕን፡ ወምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ መስቀል፡ ምስለ፡ አብሁ፡ ዘወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ወምስለ፡ እሙ፡ ጸዳለ፡ ማርያም
The note is written in a poor hand, with admixture of Amharic and Tǝgrǝñña, as if it were a writing exercise. It states that bǝğǝr wäddi (Amh. bäğǝrond) Gäbrä Mädḫǝn bought the Ms. and donated it to the tabot of the Saviour of the World, the church of ʾIyäsus (Betä ʾIyäsus). Subsequently, Gäbrä Mädḫǝn’s family members are mentioned: his wife Wälättä Mäsqäl, his father Zä-Wäldä Maryam and his mother Ṣädalä Maryam.

Fols. 8r-41r (in the bottom margin): Unidentified theological treatise on Christology.
The text is written in the main hand. The initial rubricated lines on fol. 8r and some lines on fols. 9v, 11v, 13v, 14r, 15v, 17v, 18r-20v, 31v, 32r, 35rv, 39v, 40v are illegible due to faded ink. The initial line is rubricated.

Fols. 41v-45v (in the bottom margin): Dogmatic treatise concerning the doctrines of Qǝbat and Yä-ṣägga lǝğ.Fols. 41v-45v (in the bottom margin): ዮሐንስ፡ ወለዶሙ፡ ለተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወለተክለ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ በዘመነ፡ መንግሥቶሙ፡ ተለወጠ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወክሕዱ፡ ሰብ፡ አበሻ…
The text is written in Amharic with quotations in Gǝʿǝz, in the main hand, but in a slightly bigger script. It deals with the Christological doctrines of Qǝbat and Yä-ṣägga lǝğ.

Fols. 46r-64v (in the bottom margin): Excerpts from Haymanotä ʾabäw “Faith of the Fathers” and Mäṣḥafä gǝbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Passion Week”.
The texts are written in the main hand, but in a slightly bigger script. The initial line is rubricated. The excerpts are as follows: 1) Two treatises of Hippolytus of Rome (fols. 46r-54rb) (cf. Haymanotä ʾabäw, Addis Abäba 1967 A.M. [1974/75 A.D.], ch. 41, parts 6, 7). 2) Address of Severos of Antioch to the king (fols. 54v-57r) (cf. Haymanotä ʾabäw ch. 85, part 5). 3) Homily by ʾabba Sinoda (Shenute) on distinguishing good and evil deeds (fols. 57v-61v) (cf. Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat, 1950, p. 62-3). 4) Excerpt from the Wisdom of Sirach (Sir. 12: 13-18) (fols. 62v-64v) (cf. Gǝbrä Ḥǝmamat, Addis Abäba 1950, p. 199).

person.persName: The original owner of the Ms. was probably Gäbrä Ṣǝyon mentioned in the concluding supplication formulas on fols. 59vb and 63ra (s. also fols. 3va, 4ra, 66rb) and in the prayers of Text V. On fols. 15vb, 31ra, 59vb and 63ra, other individuals are mentioned: Qäṣäla Giyorgis, Gäbrä ʾIyäsus, Gäbrä Śǝllase, Wälättä Kidan and “the children of the community” (däqiqä maḫbär). Later, the Ms. was bought by Gäbrä Mädḫǝn who donated it to [the tabot of] the Saviour of the World of the church ʾIyäsus (s. Additio 1). His name and the name of his wife are crudely added interlineally on fols. 31ra, 55va.
